feedback.Physical Object: Excluded — The ignition system is a distributed set of components rather than a singular, bounded object.
feedback.Synthetic: Included — Engineered and assembled using industrial processes.
feedback.Biological/Biomimetic: Excluded — No relationship to biological systems.
feedback.Powered: Included — Requires battery power to drive sensors, ignition coils, and ECUs.
feedback.Structural: Included — Embedded physically in the engine and dashboard architecture.
feedback.Observable: Excluded — Only visible through user interface elements, not as a unit.
feedback.Physical Medium: Included — Built from metal, wiring, and electronic modules.
feedback.Active: Included — Drives electrical and mechanical changes to initiate engine function.
feedback.Intentionally Designed: Included — Built specifically to control engine startup and input logic.
feedback.Outputs Effect: Included — Triggers electrical and mechanical ignition events.
feedback.Processes Signals/Logic: Included — Validates key/fob, handles timing and conditions.
feedback.State-Transforming: Included — Switches engine from off to active.
feedback.Human-Interactive: Included — Activated via key, button, or electronic trigger by the driver.
feedback.System-integrated: Included — Embedded within vehicle’s engine and control system.
feedback.System-Essential: Included — Without it, the vehicle cannot start.
feedback.Signalling: Included — Communicates ignition status via dashboard lights, feedback tones, and security indicators.
feedback.Rule-governed: Included — Operates under deterministic timing and safety logic.
feedback.Compositional: Excluded — Not an abstract modular system.
feedback.Meta: Excluded — Does not self-represent or manage metadata.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Relies on timing for ignition spark and safety delays.
feedback.Social Construct: Excluded — Defined materially and functionally, not by social agreement.
feedback.Institutionally Defined: Excluded — Defined by engineering and design, not by classification alone.
feedback.Identity-Linked: Excluded — Not tied to identity or symbolic role.
feedback.Regulated: Included — Subject to formal emissions, anti-theft, and safety standards.
feedback.Economically Significant: Included — Critical to the function and value of all vehicles.
feedback.Politicised: Excluded — Not subject to ideological conflict or cultural controversy.
feedback.Ritualised: Excluded — Not involved in cultural or ceremonial behavior.
feedback.Ethically Significant: Included — Directly tied to safety, theft prevention, and emissions responsibility.

encoding_notes: This encoding defines the ignition system as a structurally embedded, functionally autonomous subsystem critical to vehicle operation. It communicates with users and is subject to regulation, reflecting its real-world complexity.
